reviews.review_msg: Without a doubt the worst class I have ever taken. Final was unnecessarily difficult and unmanageable to do in 3 hours, questions were confusing and some were outside the scope of 211, no guidelines on what was expected. Other assignments had vague instructions, neither ta's nor cecilia were helpful.

looks for one specific answer with no direction to what they want in the questions and u will fully get a 0 on the questions. Cant get a response about marks, I asked her in person for the expected correct answer she said she didn't know and had to check...overall class final grade avg was a B- (53% final exam avg) enough said don't ever take this

If I could give a 0 I would. Cecilia used lectures recorded by a diff professor (cant be sped up with ~90 slides). The final exam avg was 53% making this the actual worst class in the world even though u would not expect it. My OCHEM class avg was higher than this class. Run away from this prof she seems to not even know the answers herself

Grades were curved down after a final exam that ended up having a 53% average. Was given another profs PowerPoint slides to watch every week, and exams had no clear grading criteria at all - with the expectation to include the most specific things - sometimes not even in slides. Ended up dropping 3 letter grades after the final..

Nearly all lectures were recorded by a different professor. After doing nothing all semester, Cecilia then had the audacity to make the final the hardest test I have ever taken. The marking was so ridiculously specific/questions were vague to the point it was impossible to get a good mark, avg was 53. TAs give bad feedback, avoid this class.

Prof. Heredia is an amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students. She is always willing to answer questions in lectures, office hours, and emails. She values learning over just grading and I admire her for her passion. Her class was easy to understand & assignments help you learn. She marks very fairly. A very kind & passionate person.

Cecilia is the best! She's so kind and makes everything so accessible to students. Also super inclusive and socially aware, which makes students feel comfortable in her class. Always open to feedback from us and really puts students first in her teaching! Posts slides & assignment info early and is so organized/structured too. Definitely recommend!

I thoroughly enjoyed being in Cecilia's class. You can tell that she is passionate about the topics that were being taught. She also tried her best to be inclusive and offered a wide range of perspectives with the readings that she assigned weekly. It may seem like that there's a lot of work to do on a weekly basis but it's definitely manageable.
I love this professor! She is such a sweetheart with engaging lectures and a lovely personality. She is very happy to help too and super easy to ask questions.

Great prof but would be greater if her classes weren't at 8:30 (haha). She loves the content and is super passionate about it. I took 304 and 307 with her and both classes were super easy with not that much work involved.

Overall the course was easy and the assignments were not hard. However, you need to study a bit more for the exams. One thing that annoyed me was that she said she only would curve the final if needed and mentioned this in the syllabus. However, when she posted the grades my A- was dropped to B-!! She said that its according to the grading policy
Favourite professor ever. Only anything thing is that she only teaches classes at 8:30, but at least she obviously cares about the content. Love her

Professor Heredia is one of the sweetest and most patient HSCI professors I have ever had. She is so understanding, her assignments, participation quizzes, and exams are all super straightforward. She is so accessible outside of class and goes out of her way to help you out!

This lady should just teach all the HSCI classes in the faculty. In addition to being accessible and passionate, she actually makes sure you learn the material and doesnt throw random unnecessary facts for you to memorize. Straightforward class with excellent teaching format.

Cecilia is great! I had her for an 8:30aM class (dreadful... )and she was always so understanding if students were tired. Her material is straight forward and her tests are fair. If you study, you will pass. She is always accessible outside of class and willing to help her students. Take a course with her if you can!

Cecilia is the most engaging and passionate HSCI prof I have ever had at SFU. She is very easy to contact through email and usually replies within the same day. All assignments and exams were straightforward and grading was always fair. Would recommend her to anyone!

Forgot to rate her back in spring semester but here is my review: minimal effort but still received a high grade, 2-3 easy assignments, midterm was really easy (think It was mc, fill in blank and short answer). I think final was supposed to be the same format but due to corona, it ended up being an assignment

One of the best profs. Very caring and wants her students to do well! Homework assignments are fair and easy to do. Exams are all based off of her lectures which are clear and not lengthy. Take a class with her!

She was an amazing prof! While you did have to study as there was a lot of content, she told you exactly what to study and all the readings and lecture content was put straight onto the exam. She was also super available outside of class and all around a fantastic prof. Would 100% take another class with her!
Cecilia is awesome! She took so much time out of her day to help me with the homework assignments. She was also very encouraging and a fair professor. If you study, you do well! Highly recommend!
